resource.name: Nhip
resource.description: This Capability Statement describes the requirements for the nHIP programme of work

text.div:
Prototype Capability Statement for September 2013 Connectathon

The server offers read and search support on the following resource types:

  • Patient
  • DocumentReference
  • Condition
  • DiagnosticReport

resource.name: PHR Template
resource.description: Prototype Capability Statement for September 2013 Connectathon

rest.documentation: Protoype server Capability Statement for September 2013 Connectathon

security.description: We recommend that PHR servers use standard OAuth using a          standard 3rd party provider. We are not testing the ability to provide an          OAuth authentication/authorization service itself, and nor is providing          any security required for the connectathon at all

interaction.documentation: When a client searches patients with no search criteria, they get a list of all patients they have access too. Servers may elect to offer additional search parameters, but this is not required

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: _id parameter always supported. For the connectathon, servers may elect which search parameters are supported

searchParam.name: service
searchParam.documentation: which diagnostic discipline/department created the report

text.div:
Prototype Capability Statement for September 2013 Connectathon

The server offers read and search support on the following resource types:

  • Patient
  • DocumentReference
  • Condition
  • DiagnosticReport

resource.name: PHR Template
resource.description: Prototype Capability Statement for September 2013 Connectathon

fhir_comments: while the FHIR infrastructure is turning over prior to development, a version is required. Note that this may be rescinded later
for the connectathon, servers should support both xml and json. Clients can use only one.

rest.documentation: Protoype server Capability Statement for September 2013 Connectathon

security.description: We recommend that PHR servers use standard OAuth using a          standard 3rd party provider. We are not testing the ability to provide an          OAuth authentication/authorization service itself, and nor is providing          any security required for the connectathon at all

fhir_comments: patient resource: read and search for patients the authenticated user has access too

interaction.documentation: When a client searches patients with no search criteria, they get a list of all patients they have access too. Servers may elect to offer additional search parameters, but this is not required

fhir_comments: document reference resource: read and search

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: _id parameter always supported. For the connectathon, servers may elect which search parameters are supported

fhir_comments: for the purposes of the connectathon, servers can choose which additional resources to support. Here's a couple of examples
Condition - let the patient see a list of their Conditions
Diagnostic Reports - can be lots of these, so we'll suggest that at least service category should be supported as a search criteria

searchParam.name: service
searchParam.documentation: which diagnostic discipline/department created the report

text.div:
CARIN Blue Button Server CapabilityStatement

  • Implementation Guide Version: 0.1.43-DRAFT
  • FHIR Version: 4.0.1
  • Supported formats: xml, json
  • Published: 2019-12-04
  • Published by HL7 International and CARIN Alliance

This Section describes the expected capabilities of the CARIN Blue Button Server actor which is responsible for providing responses to the queries submitted by the CARIN Blue Button Requestors. The complete list of FHIR profiles, RESTful operations, and search parameters supported by CARIN Blue Button Servers are defined.

FHIR RESTful Capabilities

The CARIN Blue Button Server SHALL:

  1. Support the CARIN Blue Button Patient resource profile.
  2. Support at least one additional resource profile from the list of CARIN Blue Button Profiles.
  3. Implement the RESTful behavior according to the FHIR specification.
  4. Return the following response classes:
    • (Status 400): invalid parameter
    • (Status 401/4xx): unauthorized request
    • (Status 403): insufficient scope
    • (Status 404): unknown resource
    • (Status 410): deleted resource.
  5. Support json source formats for all CARIN Blue Button interactions.

The CARIN Blue Button Server SHOULD:

  1. Support xml source formats for all CARIN Blue Button interactions.
  2. Identify the CARIN Blue Button profiles supported as part of the FHIR meta.profile attribute for each instance.

Security:

  1. See the General Security Considerations section for requirements and recommendations.
  2. A server SHALL reject any unauthorized requests by returning an HTTP 401 unauthorized response code.

resource.name: CARINBlueButton_HealthPlanAPICapabilityStatement
resource.title: CARIN Blue Button Health Plan API CapabilityStatement
resource.description: This Section describes the expected capabilities of the CARIN Blue Button Server actor which is responsible for providing responses to the queries submitted by the CARIN Blue Button Requestors. The complete list of FHIR profiles, RESTful operations, and search parameters supported by CARIN Blue Button Servers are defined.

rest.documentation:
The CARIN Blue Button Server **SHALL**:

1. Support the CARIN Blue Button Patient resource profile.
2. Support at least one additional resource profile from the list of CARIN Blue Button Profiles.
3. Implement the RESTful behavior according to the FHIR specification.
4. Return the following response classes:
   - (Status 400): invalid parameter
   - (Status 401/4xx): unauthorized request
   - (Status 403): insufficient scope
   - (Status 404): unknown resource
   - (Status 410): deleted resource.
5. Support json source formats for all CARIN Blue Button interactions.

The CARIN Blue Button Server **SHOULD**:

1. Support xml source formats for all CARIN Blue Button interactions.
2. Identify the CARIN Blue Button profiles supported as part of the FHIR `meta.profile` attribute for each instance.

security.description:
1. See the [General Security Considerations](Authorization,_Authentication,_and_Registration.html) section for requirements and recommendations.
2. A server **SHALL** reject any unauthorized requests by returning an `HTTP 401` unauthorized response code.

operation.name: expand
operation.documentation: A  client can determine the note and report types support by a server by invoking the standard FHIR Value Set Expansion ($expand) operation defined in the FHIR R4 specification. Because servers may support different read and write formats, it also is used to determine the formats (for example, text, pdf) the server supports read and write transactions.

  • Published: 2019-12-04

text.div:
CARIN BlueButton Consumer App CapabilityStatement

  • Implementation Guide Version: 0.1.43-DRAFT
  • FHIR Version: 4.0.1
  • Supported formats: xml, json
  • Published: 2019-12-04
  • Published by HL7 International and CARIN Alliance

This Section describes the expected capabilities of the CARIN Blue Button Consumer App which is responsible for creating and initiating the queries for information about an individual patient. The complete list of FHIR profiles, RESTful operations, and search parameters supported by CARIN Blue Button Servers are defined in the Conformance Requirements for Server.CARIN Blue Button Consumer Apps have the option of choosing from this list to access necessary data based on their local use cases and other contextual requirements.

FHIR RESTful Capabilities

The CARIN Blue Button Consumer App SHALL:

  1. Support fetching and querying of one or more CARIN Blue Button profile(s), using the supported RESTful interactions and search parameters declared in the US Core Server CapabilityStatement.

Security:

  1. See the General Security Considerations section for requirements and recommendations.

resource.name: CARIN_BlueButton_Consumer_App_CapabilityStatement
resource.title: CARIN BlueButton Consumer App CapabilityStatement
resource.description: The Section describes the expected capabilities of the CARIN Blue Button Consumer App which is responsible for creating and initiating the queries for information about an individual patient. The complete list of FHIR profiles, RESTful operations, and search parameters supported by CARIN Blue Button Servers are defined in the [Conformance Requirements for Server](CapabilityStatement-carin-bb-server.html). CARIN Blue Button Consumer Apps have the option of choosing from this list to access necessary data based on their local use cases and other contextual requirements.

rest.documentation:
The CARIN Blue Button Consumer App **SHALL**:

1. Support fetching and querying of one or more CARIN Blue Button profile(s), using the supported RESTful interactions and search parameters declared in the CARIN Blue Button Server CapabilityStatement

security.description: 1. See the [General Security Considerations] section for requirements and recommendations.

operation.name: expand
operation.documentation: A  client can determine the note and report types support by a server by invoking the standard FHIR Value Set Expansion ($expand) operation defined in the FHIR R4 specification. Because servers may support different read and write formats, it also is used to determine the formats (for example, text, pdf) the server supports read and write transactions.

resource.name: PRA-ESOURCE
resource.title: Philips IBE CapabilityStatement Statement
resource.description: This is the FHIR capability statement for the Philips IBE solution.  The application is a client, and thus only reads FHIR resources from other FHIR systems.
resource.purpose: Philips IBE capability statement, published for Connectahon 2020.

rest.documentation: The Philips IBE solution converts HL7 to FHIR and has the capability to publish FHIR bundle on a REST endpoint. Also it has the capability to query REST endpoint to retrieve resources for forms processing.

text.div: This CapabilityStatement describes the Document Consumer actor in the IHE Mobile access to Health Documents (MHD) Rev. 3.1 Profile. The IHE MHD Profile text is Normative, this conformance resource is Informative.

text.div:
The EHR Server supports the following transactions for the resource Person: read, vread, update, history, search(name,gender), create and updates.

The EHR System supports the following message: admin-notify::Person.

The EHR Application has a general document profile.
